## Description {#details}

Represents a single bitcode record type.

This class template is meant to be instantiated and then given a name, so that from then on that name can be used.

Definition at line 357 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h">BitcodeConvenience.h</a>.

## Public Member Attributes

### AbbrevCode {#ae1ae4bb0108500816aa2713426c69463}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename IDField, typename... Fields&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>const unsigned llvm::BCGenericRecordLayout&lt; IDField, Fields &gt;::AbbrevCode</>}>
The abbreviation code used for this record in the current block.

Note that this is not the same as the semantic record code, which is the first field of the record.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h/#l00365">365</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h">BitcodeConvenience.h</a>.

eturns The abbreviation code for the newly-registered record type.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h/#l00383">383</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h">BitcodeConvenience.h</a>.

### emitRecord() {#ae7d7f30535b188ea68c4b3b617ad0483}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename BufferTy, typename... Data&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static void llvm::BCGenericRecordLayout&lt; IDField, Fields &gt;::emitRecord (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitstreamwriter">llvm::BitstreamWriter</a> &amp; Stream, BufferTy &amp; buffer, unsigned abbrCode, unsigned recordID, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a> &amp;&amp;... data)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Emit a record identified by <code>abbrCode</code> to bitstream reader <code>Stream</code>, using <code>buffer</code> for scratch space.

Note that even fixed arguments must be specified here. Blobs are passed as StringRefs, while arrays can be passed inline, as aggregates, or as pre-encoded <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> data. Skipped values and empty arrays should use the special Nothing value.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h/#l00397">397</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h">BitcodeConvenience.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### readRecord() {#add884a0033e0ba600114f12cc3ccd229}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename ElementTy, typename... Data&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static void llvm::BCGenericRecordLayout&lt; IDField, Fields &gt;::readRecord (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; ElementTy &gt; buffer, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a> &amp;&amp;... data)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Extract record data from <code>buffer</code> into the given data fields.

Note that even fixed arguments must be specified here. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> <code>Nothing</code> if you don&#39;t care about a particular parameter. Blob data is not included in the buffer and should be handled separately by the caller.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h/#l00415">415</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h">BitcodeConvenience.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### readRecord() {#aa8a015d7d91c6367f5c59c47f7303eb0}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename BufferTy, typename... Data&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static void llvm::BCGenericRecordLayout&lt; IDField, Fields &gt;::readRecord (BufferTy &amp; buffer, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a> &amp;&amp;... data)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Extract record data from <code>buffer</code> into the given data fields.

Note that even fixed arguments must be specified here. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> <code>Nothing</code> if you don&#39;t care about a particular parameter. Blob data is not included in the buffer and should be handled separately by the caller.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h/#l00431">431</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodeconvenience-h">BitcodeConvenience.h</a>.
